thread.title: Prosecutors, Investors Propose Plan to Oust Malaysian Investor from Hotel Consortium - WSJ
thread.title_full: Prosecutors, Investors Propose Plan to Oust Malaysian Investor from Hotel Consortium - WSJ

author: Peter Grant
title: Prosecutors, Investors Propose Plan to Oust Malaysian Investor from Hotel Consortium - WSJ
text:
Markets Prosecutors, Investors Propose Plan to Oust Malaysian Investor from Hotel Consortium The motion is part of broader efforts to seize assets from financier Jho Low as part of the 1MDB probe Por @bradleyhope Updated Feb. 1, 2017 7:55 p.m. ET 
The U.S. Justice Department and New York property developer Steven Witkoff have asked a federal court to approve a plan to remove a financier accused in a massive international fraud from the group that owns the financially troubled Park Lane Hotel in Manhattan, according to court papers 
The move is part of a broader effort launched last year by the Justice Department to seize assets held by Jho Low, the financier and a confidant of Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak. Both have been linked by U.S. prosecutors to... To Read the Full Story, Suscribirse o Sign In Most Popular Videos
